Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.2: PRESSURE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A sequence number uniquely identifying theproduction test being performed in the well.
Column Comment.3: BOTTOM HOLE PRESSURE OBSERVATION NUMBER: Number identifying thebottom hole pressure observation.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BHFP: The measured pressure taken at the recorder depth. This is the static bottomhole pressure measured after the well has been shutin.
Column Comment.6: BHFP OUOM: Recorder depth pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.7: BHP METHOD: Code describing the method of measuring the bottom hole pressure(e.g., measured, calculated, etc.)
Column Comment.8: BOTTOM HOLE PRESSURE TEST TYPE: This reference table represents the typeof bottom hole pressure test conducted on the wellbore. For example, bottom holestatic gradient, bottom hole buildup, top hole buildup etc.
Column Comment.9: DATUM PRESSURE: The bottom hole pressure corrected to sea level.
Column Comment.10: DATUM PRESSURE OUOM: Datum pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: PACKER DEPTH: Measured depth the packer was set at during the bottom holepressure test. Packers isolate portions of the well for testing.
Column Comment.14: PACKER DEPTH OUOM: Packer depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.15: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.16: PRESSURE GRADIENT: The pressure gradient near the run depth.
Column Comment.17: PRESSURE GRADIENT OUOM: Pressure gradient original unit of measure.
Column Comment.18: RECORDER DATUM: The elevation relative of the measurement point on therecorder relative to the WELL.ELEV_REF_DATUM (a fixed datum reference).Computed as RECORDER_DEPTH - WELL. DEPTH_DATUM_ELEV
Column Comment.19: SEA LEVEL DATUM OUOM: Sea level datum original unit of measure.
Column Comment.20: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.21: REPORTED RUN TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH: The reported depth of a well measuredvertically from the surface to the point of interest in the well bore. These reportedvalues may not represent the actual TVD as derivable from the directional survey andmay consequently be in error.
Column Comment.22: REPORTED RUN TRUE VERTICAL DEPTH ORIGINAL UNITS OF MEASURE:
Column Comment.23: RUN DEPTH: The run depth. The depth at which the bottom hole pressure readingwas taken by the recorder.
Column Comment.24: RUN DEPTH OUOM: Run depth original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: RUN DEPTH TEMPERATURE: The temperature which is measured at the recorderdepth.
Column Comment.26: RUN DEPTH TEMPERATURE OUOM: Run depth temperature original unit ofmeasure.
Column Comment.27: SHUTIN PERIOD: The shutin period. The duration of time that the well was shutinallowing the pressure to build-up to the formation pressure.
Column Comment.28: SHUTIN PERIOD OUOM: Shutin period original unit of measure.
Column Comment.29: SURVEY DATE: Date the bottom hole pressure test was performed.
Column Comment.30: TEST DURATION: The duration of the bottom hole pressure test. The length of timefor the bottom hole pressure test.
Column Comment.31: TEST DURATION OUOM: Test duration original unit of measure
Column Comment.32: TUBING SIZE DESCRIPTION: Description of the tubing size used during the bottomhole pressure test (e.g., 7 1/2 inches).
Column Comment.33: WELL HEAD PRESSURE: The well head pressure. The pressure on the fluid at thetop of the well after the well has been shutin for a period of time.
Column Comment.34: WELL HEAD PRESSURE OUOM: Well head pressure original unit of measure.
Column Comment.35: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.36: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.37: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.38: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.39: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.40: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.41: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
